meanings.definition: Resembling wax in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The cerous petals of the flower glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The candle had a cerous sheen that made it look like it was made of wax.
meanings.sent3: The cerous statue looked so realistic that people often tried to touch it.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was so smooth and cerous, it felt like touching a candle.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to create a cerous finish on the sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The cerous leaves of the plant repelled water effectively.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the car's cerous surface sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cerous coating on the apple made it look too shiny to be real.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a way that gave it a cerous shine.
meanings.sent5: The cerous layer on the cheese kept it fresh for a long time.

meanings.sent1: The cerous substance used in the art class was easy to mold.
meanings.sent2: The cerous material had a distinct smell that reminded her of candles.
meanings.sent3: The cerous texture of the crayon made it perfect for detailed drawings.
meanings.sent4: His cerous hands showed that he had been working with wax all day.
meanings.sent5: The cerous candle burned brightly, filling the room with a warm glow.
